body: The state of the official Ruqqus discord right now is a disgrace. Admins don't communicate to mods, mods don't communicate to users. Mods consistently underregulate until the server gets so bad that they lock channels, enforce rules that aren't set out in #rules, and hand out mutes/bans extrajudicially. This results in constant and earned emnity between the users and the mods, and I'd unhealthy for the channel. I propose that the moderators are replaced with people who can do the job they signed up for.

body: Here's the thing. The Discord server was created to discuss Ruqqus, its development, and its future. To discuss ruqqus theory and share feedback. When we had less than 400 members, the topic chats were fine. Nothing crazy. Minimal shitposting and we didn't have to constantly moderate. After the rapid growth to 4k members; it's gotten hectic and we've had to spend more time moderating. We'd rather spend it working on and improving ruqqus. New users see the Discord as a chat extension of Ruqqus, but that's not the purpose. We'll be restructuring the Discord so that it goes back to the way it was. Ruqqus-related discussion.

body: Have you considered revoking its official status? It's not really working the way it is now, including new users seeing it as a chat extension of Ruqqus. On top of that some of the people running the Discord are not even Ruqqus admins, which can cause issues. Plus, there's too many people who can't get on Discord, and Discord honestly does not mesh with Ruqqus at all. I think it would be a great idea as an unofficial server, but trying to affiliate it with Ruqqus is clearly becoming more and more of an issue. It needs to operate independently if any of these problems are going to be resolved.

body: I think a lot of people are failing to understand that the server is supposed to be discussing Ruqqus as a freespeech website, they are upset at the mods when their memes/messages get removed for violating discord TOS and are constantly engaging in unnecessary conflict ultimately wasting the mods and everyone else's time. You should restructure the server to where people are forced to read the rules first and have them verify that they read them before given access to the server, that way they are aware that the discord is not a place to be edgy on.

body:
I think restructuring for rules shouldn't be needed. If a user joins a team without reading rules or ToS, it would be their responsibility. A mod should deal with any rulebreaker on the spot. But I think they make the mistake of not doing it. They just remove the post and don't officially warn the users that broke the rules, and so the users keep testing the mods' patience.

I've been informed now that they'll be restructuring the channels, and it'll be crystal clear on behavior rules on Ruqqus discord afterwords, hopefully. Right now, there are 3 servers AFAIK about Ruqqus (The +Dankmemes discord server, the +animemes discord server and another unofficial off topic server for all the shitposters.)

Mods consistently underregulate until the server gets so bad that they lock channels, enforce rules that aren't set out in #rules, and hand out mutes/bans extrajudicially. I propose that the moderators are replaced with people who can do the job they signed up for.

parent.body: Here's the thing. The Discord server was created to discuss Ruqqus, its development, and its future. To discuss ruqqus theory and share feedback. When we had less than 400 members, the topic chats were fine. Nothing crazy. Minimal shitposting and we didn't have to constantly moderate. After the rapid growth to 4k members; it's gotten hectic and we've had to spend more time moderating. We'd rather spend it working on and improving ruqqus. New users see the Discord as a chat extension of Ruqqus, but that's not the purpose. We'll be restructuring the Discord so that it goes back to the way it was. Ruqqus-related discussion.

body:
> I propose that the moderators are replaced with people who can do the job they signed up for.

I like the current mods, however I am angry about how they were chosen (arbitrarily because the admins know them). They need to be chosen fairly so the job is open to all users of Ruqqus, or strictly limited to admins. Not just having authority over an *official* Ruqqus affiliation given to people the admins decide they like while everyone else is completely barred from it.

body:
How would someone usually go about hiring new employees? That requires much more trust. Yet while nepotism will still sway things a bit, it's not 100% impossible for someone new to get involved, in fact that will be the majority of the cases. There are plenty of trustworthy users on this site who should be able to qualify to help the admins with these kinds of roles, not only these two that the admins keep turning to every time. I've run and created several subreddits before and I only ever had 2 problem mods running it the way I'm proposing, and they were actually from reddit's main cabal. I sometimes did add people I knew already, but that was mostly because I knew the admins would eventually find some excuse to suspend me (and boy was I right *twice*). But all my subs have always been open for new mods and I met most of my current ones that way.

Also what do you mean by "brigading"?

body:
I wholeheartedly agree. And on the official one mods should either be Ruqqus admins only or there should be an actual mod application process. The current system of the admins just modding their friends with zero ways for anyone else to become a mod is not an acceptable system for anything official imo. I hope after being stuck on reddit for so long everyone can see the obvious problems with the current approach. (Hate to disappoint you, but that's the reason why they probably won't let you become a mod as it is now. Still can't hurt to ask though!)

Discord is also way too hard for many people to access due to absurd verification and the employees are also corrupt and ban people for no reason, so for a free speech platform it's not a viable way for users to stay updated.

Mods consistently underregulate until the server gets so bad that they lock channels, enforce rules that aren't set out in #rules, and hand out mutes/bans extrajudicially. This results in constant and earned emnity between the users and the mods, and I'd unhealthy for the channel. I propose that the moderators are replaced with people who can do the job they signed up for.

body:
To be fair, the mods aren't friends of any of the admin, just long-time members of Ruqqus who are active on the discord. I haven't asked to be a mod before just now. I can't speak for the others, but Angstkitten only got modded because she was on Discord after the admins went to bed and people started spamming NSFW stuff in a SFW channel. i believe she messaged the admins and they modded her so she could take care of it. It was a "right place at the right time" thing and not a favoritism thing at all.

I know before this massive influx of users, admins were thinking about implementing some kind of "trusted user" system so they admins didn't get overwhelmed dealing with reports once the site gets bigger, but with the way people are reacting to the discord mods, it may give people the impression that admins have favorites.

parent.body:
How would someone usually go about hiring new employees? That requires much more trust. Yet while nepotism will still sway things a bit, it's not 100% impossible for someone new to get involved, in fact that will be the majority of the cases. There are plenty of trustworthy users on this site who should be able to qualify to help the admins with these kinds of roles, not only these two that the admins keep turning to every time. I've run and created several subreddits before and I only ever had 2 problem mods running it the way I'm proposing, and they were actually from reddit's main cabal. I sometimes did add people I knew already, but that was mostly because I knew the admins would eventually find some excuse to suspend me (and boy was I right *twice*). But all my subs have always been open for new mods and I met most of my current ones that way.

Also what do you mean by "brigading"?

parent.body: Here's the thing. The Discord server was created to discuss Ruqqus, its development, and its future. To discuss ruqqus theory and share feedback. When we had less than 400 members, the topic chats were fine. Nothing crazy. Minimal shitposting and we didn't have to constantly moderate. After the rapid growth to 4k members; it's gotten hectic and we've had to spend more time moderating. We'd rather spend it working on and improving ruqqus. New users see the Discord as a chat extension of Ruqqus, but that's not the purpose. We'll be restructuring the Discord so that it goes back to the way it was. Ruqqus-related discussion.

body:
At least one of them joined only two months ago.

And I've noticed the very same users being favored in other places too, like being guildmasters of guilds created by the admins. If you look at their posts they also give the impression that they hold some authority here, and some posts even seem like the admins told them to post it. The admins also respond to them the most often, and they respond to the admins' posts most often too, and sometimes even it feels like they're forcibly trying to make conversation. This is why I wonder if they're coordinating somewhere, probably in private channels that are supposed to be for admins (no word on this as of yet). With good intentions of course, but I'm very uncomfortable with it because we're supposed to have learned from DefaultMods and whatever Digg's cabal called themselves. And if this "trusted user" thing gets implemented, I think I already know who's getting it.

body:
Yeah but the trolls looking to cause trouble usually can't give actual answers to questions about modding. That's why there would be a *process* for applying for these roles, not "add anyone who asks".

I'm not saying to just add a bunch of people who joined a day ago and are flooding the servers as delegates. I'm saying that the opportunity should be available to more *trustworthy* users who aren't part of the lucky few that are already friends with the admins (and perhaps they *will* get to know the admins better while performing these duties).

parent.body:
To be fair, the mods aren't friends of any of the admin, just long-time members of Ruqqus who are active on the discord. I haven't asked to be a mod before just now. I can't speak for the others, but Angstkitten only got modded because she was on Discord after the admins went to bed and people started spamming NSFW stuff in a SFW channel. i believe she messaged the admins and they modded her so she could take care of it. It was a "right place at the right time" thing and not a favoritism thing at all.

I know before this massive influx of users, admins were thinking about implementing some kind of "trusted user" system so they admins didn't get overwhelmed dealing with reports once the site gets bigger, but with the way people are reacting to the discord mods, it may give people the impression that admins have favorites.
